title: Santa Clara County: Shigella outbreak victims now up to 110
text:
Santa Clara County: Shigella outbreak victims now up to 110 By Joe Rodriguez jrodriguez@mercurynews.com Posted: 10/22/2015 10:24:51 AM PDT Updated: 10/22/2015 11:17:45 AM PDT SAN JOSE -- Santa Clara County health authorities Thursday said the number of Shigella cases linked to a downtown San Jose seafood eatery has reached 110 and urged people to carefully wash their hands to avoid transmitting the disease. 
Officials also reported that the outbreak now includes 18 victims from Alameda, San Mateo and Santa Cruz Counties. The remaining 92 cases are from Santa Clara County. 
But county authorities said the outbreak appears to be peaking. 
"What we're beginning to see is a leveling off," Santa Clara County Director of Public Health Dr. Sara Cody said. 
Two men who were sickened after eating at Mariscos San Juan restaurant on 4th Street in San Jose sued the owners for negligence Wednesday. Both were hospitalized but since have been released, though they allege they still suffer lingering effects. 
The owners have not been available for comment, but county authorities said they are cooperating with the investigation. 
Shigella infections can be very serious and, in rare cases, fatal, county officials said. The bacteria cause severe diarrhea and are easily transmitted, most often when an infected person doesn't wash hands after using the bathroom and then handles food. 
County health officials suspect the disease was spread by a contaminated food handler, but the source remains under investigation. County officials have collected stool samples from Mariscos owners and employees, but does not expect lab results until next week, Cody said.
